meanings.definition: To touch or stroke lovingly or affectionately.
meanings.sent2: He fondles the soft blanket while watching TV.
meanings.sent3: The child fondles the puppy with care and joy.
meanings.sent4: The artist fondles the brush, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The old man fondles the memories of his youth.

meanings.definition: To handle or touch in a tender or loving way.
meanings.sent1: The grandmother fondles the delicate china teacup.
meanings.sent2: He fondles the old photo with a nostalgic smile.
meanings.sent3: The gardener fondles the plants as if they were his children.
meanings.sent4: She fondles the worn-out book, treasuring its stories.
meanings.sent5: The musician fondles the strings of the guitar, producing sweet melodies.
